standard_bio: Hello! I am Prabhat Racherla, a passionate and detail-oriented Backend Engineer with a robust history of designing, developing, and deploying scalable, high-performance server-side applications. My core preference lies with Python, but I have professionally worked with and adapted to Perl, Scala, and C# when project needs required it. My expertise spans cloud infrastructure, microservices architecture, and databases.

personal_insights.title: A Digital Statement
personal_insights.content: As a seasoned Backend Engineer, my desire for a personal website was long hindered by a simple knowledge gap: frontend development. Discovering the Reflex framework and harnessing the capability of AI for implementation—was the game-changer. This portfolio is also a deliberate rejection of the 'one-page resume' tyranny and the proliferation of paid resume-builder services. It's high time to move beyond font size 9, single page resume to showcase the full, unconstrained breadth of one's imagination and best work.

personal_insights.title: Wealth Architecture
personal_insights.content: Recently, I've added genuine wealth creation to my life’s focus. Inspired by foundational texts like *The Richest Man in Babylon*, *The Psychology of Money*, and *Rich Dad Poor Dad*, I've internalized the unambiguous lesson: the '996' grind serves only to make your CEO rich enough to worry about finding parking for their yacht, while you struggle to find parking for your car. We moved from black slavery 200 years ago to corporate slavery today. I wish to be an employee or a freelancer, not a chattel, and that distinction matters profoundly.

personal_insights.title: The Value of Decency
personal_insights.content: I value a high-paying job, but it is utterly secondary to foundational human dignity: a stress-free commute, breathable air, guaranteed drinking water in summer, zero water-logging in the rains, and freedom from the 'Rental Mafia.' No exorbitant salary in a poorly managed city can compel me to compromise on this baseline decency. When you have the opportunity and means to build multiple income streams, you deserve to live as a human, not as a slave to location or circumstance.

footnote.content: PS: And yes, I was the brain, and my AI was the highly-paid, bug-fixing, problem-solver, corporate-slave, that worked 9-9-6. I didn't feel any shame in exploiting it to get this built, while I drank scotch
